title.narrative: Mobile and community-based child protection services and psychosocial support for conflict-affected children in Iraq, including adolescents

description.narrative: The project aims at providing timely, culturally-appropriate and gender-sensitive psychosocial support to conflict-affected children and their families, including identification of cases in need of immediate assistance and child protection services. Based on the specific context and on access and security considerations, TGH will be implementing a mixed static and mobile approach: -Mobile CP/PSS service approach to ensure the flexibility needed to rapidly identify and respond to the immediate needs, as well as to adapt and tailor the response. -Community-based approach is key to ensure sustainability of an action but also to strengthen the resilience of a population and restore their dignity. Regardless the context situation and accessibility, it is crucial to identify community mechanisms and work with them. This project will ensure the continuity and reinforcement of the emergency Mosul response presently being implemented by TGH, and scale up the response to ensure a proper comprehensive geographical and beneficiary coverage, based on the evolution of the context and therefore the needs of conflict-affected children. The static – including the community-based approach, and the mobile mixed approach will be strengthened allowing to run assessments, provide Psychological First Aid, identify immediate risks, including UASC as well as identifying the most at risk children and adolescents, provide immediate case management services, and psychosocial support activities. Depending on the context and accessibility, the mixed approach will ensure a proper tailoring of the response, in and out of camp, while keeping the flexibility needed to adjust and/or redeploy the action based on the needs. The present project will be implemented in both camp and out of camp locations: Khazer M1 camp, Salamiyah MoDM camp, Al-Salamiyah out of camp area, Nimrud out of camp area - in close coordination with partners intervening in these locations.
